seo.title: 48‑Hour Positano Weekend
seo.description: A practical two‑day plan: beaches, views, Path of the Gods option, and cheap eats.

intro: A 48-hour weekend in Positano is doable if you travel light, front-load arrivals, and chase views outside peak heat.

sections.title: Day 1 — arrival & morning
body: Arrive on the first SITA bus or ferry, drop bags at your accommodation or storage, and grab espresso plus sfogliatella on Via dei Mulini.
Walk down to Fornillo Beach for a swim before noon when lidos are still calm and public spots free up.

sections.title: Day 1 — afternoon & sunset
body: Ride the local bus to Nocelle for a short Path of the Gods taster; return in time for sunset on Via Cristoforo Colombo.
Book dinner on a terrace or pick up deli food for a picnic on the hostel balcony.

sections.title: Day 2 — choose-your-adventure morning
body: Option A: ferry to Amalfi and quick hop to Ravello’s Villa Cimbrone gardens; option B: join a shared boat tour for coastline views.
Pack breakfast from the bakery so you can start early without waiting for café service.

sections.title: Day 2 — wrap-up & departure
body: Squeeze in shopping at artisan sandal makers or ceramic studios before lunch.
Collect luggage 90 minutes before departure to allow for stairs and queues at the dock or bus stop.

tips: Carry a daypack under 10 kg (22 lb) so you can navigate stairs quickly.
Bookmark ferry and bus timetables offline; weekend service changes are common.

a: Yes if you focus on highlights and stay central, but two nights offer a calmer pace and backup for weather.
Via Cristoforo Colombo and the hostel terrace are easy wins; beach bars work too but expect higher prices.
